name: Palazzo Masi

reviews.text: The Palazzo is exactly as described. clean ,charming and near everythig. Daniella is a graceful presence with tips for fabulous local resturants. A wonderful experence
reviews.title: great nest in Siena
Excellent
reviews.text: Great location in the heart of Siena... literally a few yards to Il Campo on a winding cobble stone street. More than adequate for us (married couple). Room was large and clean; detached private bathroom was the same.

reviews.title: Close to everything in Siena
reviews.text: Note that the owner does not reside at the property so you have to call her when you arrive in town -- a bit of an inconvenience.

reviews.title: great location! lovely proprietors!
reviews.text: No air conditioning as the building is many hundreds of years old but we were there in June and it was not an issue.
Again, the location cannot be beat -- right in the heart of Siena. The owner was very helpful as well.
reviews.title: Missed Palio Still had a great time
Very Nice
reviews.text: My daughter and I enjoyed Palazzo Masi very much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked through Venere, who gave us a phone number to call when we arrived in Siena. Daniella sent an email to us as well and gave her cell number and reiterated that we must call when we arrive so she can be there for us. However, I didn't notice the different number so we got no answer when we called. We went ahead and went to the B&B but were waiting in front and getting nervous. I found a phone to call her again but no answer (to the phone # Venere gave) When I came back from trying to call, Daniella, and her husband were there and had taken my daughter and our bags up to our room already.
reviews.title: Nice but you can do better
Siena's BEST room and location!
reviews.text: They couldn't have been nicer. The room was very nice, with a bathroom/shower.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will say in response to the other posts I have read about stiff towels, small bathrooms, and the dark hallway, ITALY is different than USA. They use less energy and hang their towels, this is evident everywhere, just look outside, and Daniella asks to turn off lights when you go out. The hallway IS dark, but has a switch that you simply touch and it lights the hallway for a few minutes to let you in or out. And in three weeks in Italy I never found a bathroom that wasn't cramped to say the least. So what. it is just the way it is there.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First a general comment about staying in Siena. If you have a car, don't stay in the city! Parking is very restricted. The city parking lot near this hotel charges 1.60 euros/hour with no maximum. There is a free lot rather far away that was full on 2 of our 3 nights. My personal recommendation would be, if you have car, to stay in an agrotourismo outside of siena and then drive in for the touristy stuff. The price of parking would make a new york hotel proud!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!

likes.disliked: — bad towels, no life to the place

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Palazzo Masi at the beginning of the month. Daniela was very easy to communicate with over email leading up to our trip. She even gave us detailed instructions on where to park and find the B&B. I will warn those driving that the walk to the parking is a distance from the B&B and seems even longer when you're carrying luggage. The other option is to drop off your luggage at the B&B then park the car but I wouldn't want to drive the streets in Siena. While beautiful, they are windy, narrow and traveled by a few crazy drivers.
reviews.title: Convenient and adequate
Palazzo Masi marvellous
reviews.text: We stayed in the La Staffa room which had it's own bathroom. The room was very spacious and the bed was very comfortable. Daniela met us at check in and recommended two wonderful restaurants for dinner: Gallo Nero and Hosteria. We ate at both and had terrific meals.

The Palazzo Masi is located very close to il Campo which was one of the top reasons we chose it. It was convenient to everything we did in Siena. The room and building itself is very modest. Daniela's rooms only take up one floor, the rest of the building is occupied with tenants but we never ran into anyone else. I definitely recommend staying inside the walls of Siena to get the true experience of the medieval town. It was a surprising great stop on our trip though Italy.
reviews.title: Comfortable Palazzo Masi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights and as per other reviews you cannot fault the location. Make sure you telephone the owners on arrival as I forgot so we waited outside! The confirmation e-mail did request this so my mistake. The owners were very cheerful and helpful. Siena itself was amazing and I would recommend the destination. The B&B provides good budget accomodation, we did not have breakfast and had a room with toilet and shared bathroom. I didn`t find this hotel as comfortable as other budget accomodation but it is good value - we paid 180 euro for 2 people 2 nights. The buses from train station are confusing so ask for help, it would be too far to walk with luggage. We also found it tricky to find but head to Il Campo, face the tower (mangia) and it is the street in bottom right corner. If you want brilliant value local food head to Osteria Nonna Gina (7mins walk from Duomo) Staff are lovely and amazing food in rustic dining room.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — Toilet - due to age of building

reviews.title: How is it called a bed and breakfast????
reviews.text: This should NOT be called a bed and breakfast! We got to our room and we were never told about a 7 euro breakfast. It wasn't an option. This was the least of our problems. There were no amenities...not even soap for the shower. We were given the wrong room key and because there was no phone, we had to walk to a public phone to have someone come and give us the correct key. Also, the owner does not like to be inconvenienced. She is very nice, but if you want to check out early in the morning, she will make you change your plans the evening before you leave so that she doesn't have to get up early to check you out. The towels were really rough and smelled horrible. I have stayed in Siena three times and this was not the best. I will say if location is important to you, it can't be beat. Also, we had no idea that it was a cash only operation. Kind of shady, if you ask me!!

reviews.title: Fantastic Accomodation, Host and Position!
reviews.text: Palazzo Masi is in a fantastic position very close to iL Campo (the central piazza). The rooms are wonderful - we had room 2 which had shuttered windows opening onto the street, high ceilings with exposed beams, and a great ensuite that looked new!. There are some stairs to climb to get to the room but well worth it, and our Host met us there, gave us maps and helped book a tour!.This place is in a very central position. There is a fantastic deli just around the corner to - head up the street away from iL Campo take first right (yes up the steep road) then right to through the covered lane (very short) then it will be the first shop on your left

This place felt like a home away from home, because the owners are so down to earth and welcoming. We stayed in the rooms with shared bath and had 2 bedrooms for 4 people. No one else was on that floor because the owners knew we were travelling together, so it was like they "gave" us a whole apartment to have all to ourselves! The rooms are huge but fairly basic. I found the bed way too hard, unfortunately. It was sometimes very noisy due to its location right near Il Campo but that is also one of the best things about it -- being so close to where the action is in Siena. Siena is magical (maybe overly boutiquey) for just walking everywhere and this is a great location if you want to be in the heart of town. It's a good value too.
reviews.title: Wonderful Find!

likes.disliked: — Beds, some noise, lots of stairs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just recently come back from two nights stay at Palazzo Masi in Siena. We booked Palazzo Masi through Venere (great site) and corresponded prior to our leaving with Daniela through email. We had hired a car and choose to drive to the Masi's front door to drop off our luggage. Daniela gave us great instructions and she met us (after ringing her) outside the front door and made us feel very welcome. There are stairs that need to be climbed (very doable) and then we were taken to our room. We had a superior room with an ensuite and a window looking out onto the road. It was a comfortable room and we slept well with the window closed. The breakfast is most sufficient and good value for money (comparative to other breakfasts we had at different places on the same trip). And the location was brilliant! We felt like we were in the middle of it all... Daniela and her husband were very welcoming, made us lovely cappuccinos for breakfast and gave us ideas for restaurants and such. We are also very thankful to Daniela for helping us out of a problem of our own making. Thank you Daniela!
reviews.title: Location, location, location...

description: A medieval building completely restored in Siena's heart, adjacent to the Piazza del Campo and very close to the Duomo. Two different kinds of rooms, superior and standard, all equipped with antique furniture and modern amenities, in an historical building surrounded by the most important attractions in Siena.
